title: Open Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage of Senator Regina Goodwin Traffic Stop (January 11, 2025)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act (51 O.S. § 24A.1 et seq.), I am requesting access to the following public records:

All unedited body-worn camera footage from Tulsa County Sheriff's Office deputies involved in the traffic stop, detainment, and citation of Oklahoma State Senator Regina Goodwin on January 11, 2025, near the 200 block of E. Archer Street in Tulsa.

Dashcam footage from the officer who pulled the suspect over.

This request includes footage from the initial stop, all verbal exchanges between Senator Goodwin and the deputy, the moment she was placed in handcuffs, and any interactions with members of the public who approached during the stop. I request the original, unedited video as maintained by the Sheriff's Office, not a media-edited version.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage from November 2, 2024 (EverBank Stadium Incidents)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage from November 2, 2024 (EverBank Stadium Incidents)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

am requesting access to the following public records:

- All unedited body-worn camera footage recorded by JSO Deputies Officer ED Kelly, Officer DJ Bowers, Officer J Anthony, Officer JS Beasley, and Officer A Catino during two incidents involving fan altercations at the Florida-Georgia college football game at EverBank Stadium on November 2, 2024.

Specifically:
1. Footage involving the suspect accused of trespassing and attempting to disarm Officer Kelly, including the use of racial slurs and threats.
2. Footage involving the three individuals who refused to leave the stadium stands, escalated into a confrontation with officers, and were arrested with use of force and tasers.

Please include full footage from each involved officer, beginning at first contact with the individuals through the conclusion of the detainment or arrest, prior to any public redaction or media editing.

Preferred format: digital download or secure link via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Unedited Body Camera Footage from March 26, 2025 Arrest (Interchange Dr. NE)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Unedited Body Camera Footage from March 26, 2025 Arrest (Interchange Dr. NE)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- The complete, unedited body-worn camera footage from Palm Bay Police officers involved in the arrest of a trespassing suspect dressed as a clown on Wednesday, March 26, 2025, at or near the shopping center off Interchange Drive NE.

Please include footage from initial officer contact through the transport of the individual to a patrol vehicle, including any moments where a weapon (flare gun) was recovered or resisted arrest occurred.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Open Records Request – Body Camera Footage from November 10, 2024 Bridge Rescue

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request – Body Camera Footage from November 10, 2024 Bridge Rescue
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Body-worn camera footage recorded by Officer Reyes during a welfare check and rescue incident involving a man on the bridge at S. Pennsylvania and Exchange Avenue on November 10, 2024.

Please include all footage from Officer Reyes' arrival on scene through the conclusion of the rescue.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News
